subject: Law
title: Good Faith and Fair Dealing
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Good Faith and Fair Dealing.

hook.text: A landlord technically followed the lease but made the tenant's life miserable to force them out. That's bad faith.

buildup.text: Every contract includes an implied covenant of good faith and fair dealing under US law.

discovery.text: It means neither party should do anything to destroy the other's right to receive the contract's benefits.

twist.text: Good faith doesn't require generosity. It prevents using the contract as a weapon against the other party.

climax.text: Courts use it to police creative loophole exploitationâ€”the letter of the contract vs. its spirit.

punchline.text: Contracts require honesty, not just compliance.

quiz.question: What does the implied covenant of good faith prevent?
options: Destroying the other party's right to the contract's benefits
